page.title: 15RECREATION - Horse Riding
page.content: INTERVIEW with a pupil who works at a riding school. "I arrive at the farm at 8-30am. At 9am we bring the horses from the field. First we give them a feed of oats and bran and then we brush them. At 10am the riding starts. There are three rides, each lasting for one hour. There are 12 horses but at present we only use 6 because the others have not yet been broken in. At 1am we have our dinners and after that we bring in our own horses, brush them, and put on their bridles and saddles, which we calll their tack. We then go for a ride ourselves. After we have ridden our own horses we take their tack off and feed them. Then they are turned back into the field."
